instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hello!

Mac <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> turns on with battery, there is a chime, but <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is missing. No image, no backlight. USB activity is present, caps lock reacts
Without battery doesn't turns on, 20v, 0.04a
DFU restoring sucsessful. In SMC bypass mode doesn't start
Before was short on <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL>, <CAPACITOR>C9586</CAPACITOR> was shorted. After replacing the cap - short is gone, 2.5v is present.
Voltage for <CHIP>U7410</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7420</CHIP> are present, but on coils L7410 and L7420 is 0v, resistance on both coils is 3 Ohms
Try to replace FDMF5808A or CPU is dead?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Already explained thousand times on the forum.
iGPU core voltage ONLY appears when high graphics load is detected.

Try to read and take daily notes from all threads; do not limit at your ones.
You gain time finding answers in your notes, instead of expecting new ones.

Did you test external video?
Any history fault available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Sorry, i do have note book, but never faced missing cpu vcore before.

External video is missing, customer says that laptop just didn't turn on in the morning

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Do not make confusion between CPU core and iGPU core!
iGPU core gets power from CPU core power supply, at low graphics load.

Disconnect internal LCD and check again external video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message: With disconnected LCD external video also missing. Laptop is on, i can hear a sound when i plug in a charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
If Caps Lock reacts, then board boots.
Missing both internal/external video, can be iGPU problrem.
Just in case try revive in DFU; even restore, if no data needed.
